page.title: 15CEMETERY AND CREMATORIUM
page.content: The cemetery is a large place taking up 25% of a kilometre square. The 4 boundaries of the cemetery are the{A5} or{Roman Road,}a footpath, the railway and the{Longden Road.}The cemetery has been enlarged twice over the years the last extension being in l9O9. Pictures in the local studies library show a judge watching the{Bishop of Lichfield signing the opening of the extension, others show how large the cemetery and chapel are.{Mary Webb,}a local poet is buried there. The whole cemetery can be seen from the{A5}railway bridge. Three miles from the cemetery to the east of{Shrewsbury}is situated the crematorium on the{London Road.}It is about 25 years old and is very much smaller than the cemetery. However, it is used far more now than the cemetery as cremation is preferred to burial by most people in this area.
